basics.name: Martin Carrasco
basics.label: Computer Scientist
basics.summary: I am a research assistant at the Computational Linguistics and Text Mining Lab (CLTL) at VU Amsterdam. My current research is focused in exploring extractive summarization techniques by looking at the topological properties of the embedding space of text.

work.name: Computational Linguistics and Text Mining Lab (CLTL), VU Amsterdam
work.summary: Working on extending the state of the art in extractive summarization by exploring the topological properties of the embedding space of text.

work.name: Airnguru Inc.,
work.summary: In charge of developing the backend of the Airnguru platform, a platform that helps airlines optimize their revenue by providing them with a tool that helps them predict the demand of their flights.

work.name: Universidad de Ingenieria y Tecnologia
work.summary: Teaching assistant for the course Operating Systems, in charge of helping students with their assignments and exams.

volunteer.summary: Focused on computer architecture and operating systems.Produced one paper related to photonics
Daily training for ICPC competitions and IEEE Extreme Programming Competition. Participated in the ACM ICPC South America Regionals in 2019 and 2020.
Presentation of an Arts and Technology project related to Shipibo-Conibo imagery “Convirtiendo Imágenes a Sonidos”
Founding member. Gave workshops on data structures used by git, statistics and arranged talks / paper reviews

education.institution: Universidad de Ingenieria y Tecnologia, Lima, Peru

awards.title: IEEE Extreme Programming Competition - Top 100 team
awards.summary: Award for qualifying withing the top 100 teams in the IEEE Extreme Programming Competition.

certificates.name: Spring School on the introduction on numerical modelling of differential equations

publications.name: Inter-node Message Passing through Optical Reconfigurable Memory Channel
publications.summary: With advancements in computing interconnection and memory, new opportunities have emerged. We propose a novel inter-node architecture and protocol called Flexible Memory Units (FMU) that uses optically disaggregated memory.

projects.name: Quantum Computing
projects.summary: Quantum computing is the use of quantum-mechanical phenomena such as superposition and entanglement to perform computation. Computers that perform quantum computations are known as quantum computers.
